alert.note: Alert for Cheyenne; Kimball (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 22 at 4:08PM CDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of west central Cheyenne and east central Kimball Counties through 345 PM MDT... At 307 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm capable of producing a landspout over Dix, or 7 miles east of Kimball, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Landspouts, wind gusts up to 50 mph, and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Potter and Dix. This includes Interstate 80 in Nebraska between mile markers 24 and 39. LANDSPOUT...POSSIBLE MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM MDT for the Panhandle of Nebraska.
